meanings.def: to say or write the letters of a word in the correct order
examples: How do you spell your surname?
You've spelt my name wrong.
spell something with something I thought her name was Catherine, but it's Kathryn spelt with a ‘K’.
Should 'internet' be spelled with a capital or lower case i?
‘Nevaeh’ is ‘heaven’ spelled backwards/​backward.
Is ‘necessary’ spelled with one ‘s’, or two?
The article spelled ‘survey’ as ‘servay’.

meanings.def: to form words correctly from individual letters
examples: I've never been able to spell.

meanings.def: to form words when they are put together in a particular order
examples: C—A—T spells ‘cat’.

meanings.def: to have something, usually something bad, as a result; to mean something, usually something bad
examples: The crop failure spelt disaster for many farmers.
This defeat spelt the end of his hopes of winning the title again.

meanings.def: to replace for a short time somebody who is doing a particular activity so that they can rest
examples: Carter will be here in an hour to spell you.

meanings.def: a short period of time during which something lasts
examples: We had a spell of warm weather in April.
a cold spell
There will be rain at first, with sunny spells later.
She went to the doctor complaining of dizzy spells.
He's going through a bit of a bad spell at the moment.
She managed to write a letter during a quiet spell at work.
The children began having dizzy spells from hunger.
Viera ended his barren spell with a goal against Parma.
a spell of sunny weather

meanings.def: a period of time doing something or working somewhere
examples: She had a spell as a singer before becoming an actress.
I spent a brief spell on the Washington Post.

meanings.def: words that are thought to have magic power or to make a piece of magic work; a piece of magic that happens when somebody says these magic words
examples: a magic spell
a book of spells
The wizard recited a spell.
to cast/put a spell on somebody
under a spell to be under a spell (= affected by magic)
She uttered the magic word, and the spell was broken.
Sleeping Beauty was under a spell when the prince found her.
The witch cast a spell on them.

meanings.def: a quality that a person or thing has that makes them so attractive or interesting that they have a strong influence on you
examples: I completely fell under her spell.
It was a magic night until the spell was broken.
Since last century the spell of the pyramids has drawn tourists to Egypt.
This place had woven its spell over them.
the hypnotic spell of the cicadas singing in the trees
The audience was completely under his spell.

meanings.def: to perform or behave in a way that is attractive or interesting, or that makes somebody behave in a particular way
examples: Japan is gradually weaving a spell over me.

idioms.idiom: weave a spell (over somebody) | weave your magic
idioms.def: to perform or behave in a way that is attractive or interesting, or that makes somebody behave in a particular way
examples: Japan is gradually weaving a spell over me.
